Reviews.Title: “So happy we found this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: nylike2travel
Reviews.Content: We walked In here on a whim, after our travel agent booked us into A true dump. Thank god for Francesco at the front desk he was wonderful, patient with us Americans and soo helpful always with a smile. He told us they were booked but they had an apartment around the corner, we went to see it and is was perfect new kitchen, two bathrooms, a twin bed and a queen in two separate rooms and two t.v.s . Also each window opened to the courtyard. We had three nights in a wonderful apartment and saved money. So again Thank you Francesco and Hotel Oxford. He also sent us with a map on a walking tour that we followed, it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: colinshropshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel end of january 2012 for 4 day break with British Airways very good hotel good service from BA plenty of walking but well worth the experience woud def reccomend Good Breakfast, Good Clean Room,

Reviews.Title: “Fab little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sara w
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the Bad reviews on here for Hotel Oxford, we were a little worried about our holiday. I have to say that On arrival all worries disappeared instantly. Yes the hotel is "vintage" in style - but it is one of the friendliest and clean hotels i have ever stayed in. We heard some people moaning about room size and location with-in the hotel but our room was fab and overlooked the street out side. some reviews moan about the street noise but as this is a hotel in a city im not quite sure what people should expect!!?! it didnt bother us at all. This hotel building is over 100 yrs old so it has some odd shaped rooms, corridors etc but i personally think this adds to the charm. All the staff speak very good English and are very helpful when it comes to booking taxis and tables at resurants. We even found a spar shop about 5 mins walk up the street so save your self some money and buy bottles of water and snacks there. out and about water/little bottles of coke cost around 2.50 Euros each!! but only 70 cents in the spar shop. The hotels location is great for getting all over rome, we pretty much walked everywhere. we used the metro with no problems! Get a Roma Pass at the airport when you land, especially if you plan to use the metro as it is free with a roma pass! plus you get to que jump at some of the major attractions with 2 free entries and discounts on others.... Rome is a majical city i cant wait to go back one day and i would definately stay in Hotel Oxford again.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable and friendly visit”
Reviews.Author: John F
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 7 nights at the end of March 2012 and although was only a single, was allocated a double room. It was very comfortable and all the staff were friendly and could not have been more helpful including being multi-lingual. The breakfast, although Continental, was more than adequate and cooked breakfasts were available for a small extra charge. The free WiFi throughout the hotel was very useful for keeping in touch with relatives in South Africa via Skype and logging onto the Internet etc. The only draw back was that the dinner menu in the restaurant at night was very limited. However, there are plenty of local restaurants nearby and so this was not a problem. I would certainly go back to Hotel Oxford if I visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “A very clean and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: forestonion
Reviews.Content: Hotel "Oxford" is a very nice hotel just a bit outside of centre. Our room was very clean and since it's very important for us we were more than happy. The hotel doesn't have smoking rooms that makes it even greater. My parents-in- law booked the same hotel for their trip to Rome, the best sign, isn't it?

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Oxford Rome - Great”
Reviews.Author: JoanHL
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel, very helpful staff, very clean and well maintained, we had a large room with a balcony. Breakfast was plentiful and the hotel restaurant offered meals and snacks throughout the day. Free wifi in the public areas was useful as we were able to check in flights. This hotel is a 5 minute walk from Via Veneto which has lovely shops and restaurants. A further 5 minutes or so takes you to the Spanish Steps, or a little further to the Trevi Fountain. We used public transport to see the sights which were further away, but the fit and healthy could easily walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and helpfull staff, clean spacious room.”
Reviews.Author: peter l
Reviews.Content: just had a great weekend in Rome - sunshine for 4 days in March ! Hotel Oxford was close to Via Veneto in a nice area. We had a fairly large, comfortable, nice room with a balcony on the second floor. We reckon we got the balcony because my wife mentioned it was our anniversary. Nice touch. The dining and reception staff were extremely helpful and friendly - English very good. Cleaners and porters eager to please. Breakfast was excellent. This was our first time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the bustle and bus routes, but convenient for the sights”
Reviews.Author: SunshineSusieUK
Reviews.Content: A very lucky break for us as the 5 days that we stayed were blessed with glorious sunshine, a bonus in early March. We can't praise this hotel enough.Our room (342) was on third floor and the lift only goes to floor 2, so there was a stair climb to the last floor.It was a little on the small side but a comfortable bed and clean linen every day. From the reception staff to the waiting staff, all were very helpful and polite.Breakfast was a huge choice of continental, with an extra cost for anything cooked.We would recommend 3 restaurants nearby if you do not want to go into the town. La Pentolaccia on via Flavia, La Fontana on via Liguria and Brancaleone on via Sicilia. If there was a downside, it was with Appian line tours. We used them on 3 occasions and were picked up at the hotel and returned, but on the last trip we were picked up from the hotel but dropped at the piazza Berberini on the way back. Not a huge problem but we had been to the Vatican for 4 hours and an uphill walk without a map was too challenging and we had to take a taxi, adding to the expense of the day (60 euros each) It is easy to get lost, even after 3 days of familiarity. Moral of the story is to take a map wherever you go and ask if you will be returned to your hotel. It is worth having the guided tour-we saved hours of queuing at the Colosseum and Vatican.There were lots of people everywhere and I wouldn't recommend a trip in the summer months! All in all a brilliant stay. Thanks to all at the Oxford. We would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great base in Rome”
Reviews.Author: annieb69
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February for four nights. We booked this through our tour operator who classed this as a 4* hotel, it was more like a 3* but nevertheless it was clean and comfortable. The staff were very pleasant and extremely helpful, nothing was too much trouble. Their English was much better than our Italian as well. We didn't have a great view from our room on the third floor, but to be honest there was so much to see of Rome, we didn't spend that much time in it. It was a fair walk to most of the sights, however we love to walk so that wasn't a problem for us, but there were plenty of bars and restaurants to stop off at en route. I wouldn't hesitate in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff great nothing too much trouble.”
Reviews.Author: carl717
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights. Staff were really friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them. Hotel was very clean and has a nice bar area to relax in after long sightseeing days. There are some great restaurants within 5 minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: amp1
Reviews.Content: This is a lean , well managed city hotel. It is 4* in the way that many clean basic hotels are in Italian cities. It is not a big resort plush hotel . The staff are very friendly, helpful and pleasant. The room we had 116 is large overlooking the street . The bathroom is ensuite via a door up three marble steps , very weird but clean although very compact , so not good if you have mobility problems. yes you can hear the traffic but hey this is Rome not the beach. The hotel is warm ( we are here in January) so that's good, the beds are very very firm , hard but we slept very well One thing I would say if you have any form of mobility issue ( I have arthritis in my spine and sacral joints) it is a long walk to the metro not just down the road it's around 7 blocks . Fine if you know and can pace your self . The Rome tour bus stop is about 600 meteres awaynot the 200 that the hotel will tell you. Again that's fine if you know. The resterant was shut whilst we were here, but breakfast was fine good choice and tasty lots of hot milk for great coffee. It's very reasonably priced , yes it's a little tatty and faded , but it is warm safe and you are made to feel welcome . We had a good 3 night stay ,. Don't expect the ritz or the Sheraton , know you are going to a small 47 roomed Italian hotel in a huge city and enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: asiais4me
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Oxford hotel in Rome. Its location was close enough to all the historic sites but far enough away to be quiet. It was winter when we were there in December 2011 but the room was warm and clean and tidy. The staff at reception were helpful and spoke relatively good English so we had no trouble with language. The breakfast was great with all you require and very fresh. You can even boil eggs with toast which in Italy is not always available. It says its a four star which is about right but dont expect it to be like the big four star hotels. My husband & I actually preferred it the big hotels very cosy. There is internet access aswell which was handy even if it was a bit expenive. Beware if you are big as it has the smallest lift in the world!!

Reviews.Title: “four great nights”
Reviews.Author: michael f
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in November'11. Excellent location from which to explore Rome. Staff very helpful, especially Carlos and Franchesca. Bar quiet but again friendly. Room was clean, tidy and in good order. Maids very efficient but unobtrusive. All in all, one hotel I wouldn't hesitate to recommend - one I was made to feel extremely comfortable in, and which I intend to return to next year.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: UkE_b
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - hotel is about 15mins walk to Spanish Steps. Plenty of restaurants (nice choice with outside 'pods') to eat on Via Veneto which is about 10mins walk away. Hotel room was fine. A little dated, especially in bathroom and I would say is 3 star max. But room was spacious. Shower good. Bed comfortable. No tea/coffee making facilities. Ask for a room away from the road (if you don't like night time noise) as there are a lot of buses going down the adjacent street. Hotel restaurant was ok - can get better dining elsewhere closeby though. Breakfast was good - substantial and filled you up for the morning. If you get a good deal on this hotel then it is worth the stay. Repubblica and barberini metro stations are approx. 15mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Giggles1_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Oxford at the end of November for 3 nights, hotel is about 10 mins walk to the spanish steps. The Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Especially The Bar Tender Carlos who makes the best cocktails!! Our room was on the 3rd floor, which you have to walk up to from the 2nd floor but this was not a big deal. Breakfast was good, lots of choice. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: pattytofeo
Reviews.Content: Absolutely clean,the staff is very helpful and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Good but basic”
Reviews.Author: Karl L
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in Rome and found staff to be very helpful with general information. Hotel is a fair walk away from central Rome but if you are happy to walk no real problems. Rooms were basic but very clean. However the promised sat tv did not work durig our 5 day stay and although reported to reception no action taken to resolve and didn't even have in house movie channel working which was dissapointing. Food was good, bit slow but that's Italy I guess! overall had a good time in Italy and would recommend it for an inexpensive city hotel. We would stay here again Walking tip- From the hotel if walking to the Vatican take the route that goes via the spanish steps as this is a lot quicker.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ed W
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Oxford. The staff were all friendly and very helpful and they all spoke English. A special mention for Manuela on reception who arranged our airport transfers, booked our museum tickets and just about everything else we needed. The room was a little small but very clean and it had everything we needed. There was very little traffic noise, we slep with the window open which is a first for us in Rome. The breakfast buffet is very well run with a good continental breakfast Even though the hotel in not in the tourist centre of Rome (it's a 10 minute walk to the centre) there are lots of good restaurants in the surrounding streets, try "ai Fienaroli" in Via Sardegna, the food is excellent. There is a very frequent bus service into town, an all day ticket is 4 euros and a 3 day ticket 12 euros for all buses and metro. There are 3 or 4 different buses that will take you to all the tourist sites, and even better take you right home to the hotel after a long day walking round the historic sites. We have already decided that we will stay here on our next visit rather than being in the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly & convenient”
Reviews.Author: CynicalTourist
Reviews.Content: An excellently situated hotel with professional but friendly, helpful and polite staff (all of whom have a good grasp of English) who make for a most comfortable stay. Comprehensive Continental breakfast and adequate restaurant (very useful when BA get you to Rome several hours later than you plan!). Good-sized room and spotlessly clean. Cannot think of any reason why, having thrown our coins in the Trevi, we shall not stay at the Oxford when we return to The Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ms1106
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was comfortable and all aspects of the stay were very good. I felt that the hotel was not quite as central as I had thought when I booked it. We did walk every where and enjoyed our holiday immensely. Very good welcoming hotel. Happy to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Helena S
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 4 nights at the Hotel Oxford. Although the room we had was not the largest, everything was very clean and even though we were at the front of the hotel we didn't find it excessively noisy - even had the window open most nights. The breakfast was good - although perhaps the option of a cooked breakfast would be nice - serving to 10.30am was also a bonus. The restaurant menu in the evening was small and didn't change but the food was good quality and reasonably priced (for Rome) and more than adequate after a long day sightseeing. The staff were all very helpful and always cheerful, particularly the restaurant and bar staff. Although the hotel was not in the centre of Rome most of the sights were within walking distance and being slightly outside the centre meant that it was quieter and more relaxing. We would happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: Morda28
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor's review were very useful for me, so, now I'm writing a review also, maybe it will be useful for others. The summary is: not excellent, but good. This hotel is located not so close to metro and the nearest bus is in a few blocks. The street is pleasant and pretty safe, so you can walk there in the evening. There are pizzerias, restourants, shops and more nearby. The hotel has an elevator to first and second floor. I don't know what's going on on the next floors, I've lived on the second. So if you have problems with the stairs, check before. The room was very clean, little space (I took a single room), big bed, everything in the room is old, but good. Good, pretty new bathroom, all things in it worked properly, hot water (really hot water). Very quiet. Good breakfast. Pretty helpful staf. I stayed in the hotel 17-21/10/11 - the weather was changing to cold. You have the air condition in the room, but it works for cool only. On the reception they said me, that they may change it to heat in november only. I thought, that it is joke, checked with some people who live in Rome for many years. That's true. So be aware. But I have to say, that it wasn't cold in the room, maybe the walls are thick enough, or something else. Also, when you make an order check the hotel's site, the price in it is a little bit lower then through the agents. One more thing, when I was ordering, there were special gift, for ordering 3 nights and more - a free dinner. The way, it was written, I thought, that I'll get dinner every evening, during the check in, they said me, that it means 1 dinner only. It should be noticed, that when I was checking out, they tried to get money for that free dinner, as a mistake certainly. But with someone else it might work.

Reviews.Title: “Italian 4 stars are not what you may think”
Reviews.Author: George J
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel in October 2011. It is a very well used Hotel. Out side of the main public areas it is well worn. The lift is quite something with exceptionally challenging access on the upper floors. There is no sound proofing so hopefully the rest of the guests wear soft shoes. Reading the other reviews we must have stayed somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Oxford Hotel, Rome”
Reviews.Author: Usideroad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, walking distance to many tourist spots, but away from the noise. It is an older hotel but the rooms are clean and the breakfast (included) very generous. The staff is very helpful. Elevator only goes to the second floor, so if you have problems with stairs make sure to ask for a room on the first or second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, efficient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dot-7
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, fair walk to centre but knew that when we booked. Rooms good, air conditioned and spacious. Bar staff excellent, even got to watch the football on the computer behind the bar. Prices ok. Really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, good room, excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Ian C
Reviews.Content: We found the Oxford was a really good hotel: virtually all the staff spoke english and were genuinely friendly and helpful. The room was of a good standard - including a safe (-no extra charge), fridge, air con as standard. WiFi is free in communal area but an extra charge in the bedrooms (-no big deal). The Tv channel choice was limited to Sky News, CNN News & eurosport, so we ended up watching italian or spanish Tv instead, which was no bad thing and helped to get a feel for the local culture! The breakfast was outstanding - as much as you can eat, with cereals, breads, jams, juices, croissants, danish pastries, boiled eggs, etc, etc! It kept us going until the evening meal! Drawbacks: In house restaurant had limited choice for evening meal, but there were plenty of nearby cafes (-try the backstreets) I also read someone say it was centrally located.. whilst this is true, I would say it's more on the edge of the main tourist area. We walked pretty much everywhere and did not find it a problem; Here are some approximate walking times from the hotel (-we are a family of three with an 11 year old): Spanish Steps (Piazza d'Espagne): 10 mins Trevi Fountain: 10 - 15 mins Roman Forum: 20 - 25 mins Collosseum (Flavian amphitheatre): 25 mins Piazza Navona: 25 mins Vatican: 60 mins Termini station: 10 -15 mins Nearest metro stations: Termini / Piazza Republicca, Espana, Barberini Note: all day travelcard valid for metro/bus/tram inside the city was about 2.50 euros per person per day!

Reviews.Title: “It's like home to me”
Reviews.Author: davelle
Reviews.Content: Love the Oxford Hotel. Have now returned twice. Yes the hotel is vintage, yes the lift is tiny, but these are not complaints, they add to the charm. It is Italy at its best and friendliest. This time the front desk staff in particular were exceptional. We had taken three rooms, a triple, a single and a double. All were spotless, all were certainly large enough, in fact this is why we keep coming back to the Hotel Oxford. We walk everywhere, it is located in a very leafy quite area, away from hawkers, there is a little supermarket close by and some nice little eateries. We walked to the Trevi and ate at Via Veneto. The breakfast is continental and there is plenty of choice. Loved the fact that Wifi is free in your room. I simply connected my own laptop (you can use the TV) and checked messages and banked, all in the comfort and privacy of my room. I did throw a coin again in the Trevi so here's hoping I can come back to the Oxford.

Reviews.Title: “Rome re-visited after 40 years”
Reviews.Author: DENNISc C
Reviews.Content: Hardly recognised the hotel after 40 years. It has obviously expanded in the upper floors. Lobby free wi-fi very good.A/C in room excellent. Would like to have seen full English breakfast, rather than the continental style. A/C in lobby & reception needs improvement. We stayed 3 nights but had nowhere to unpack clothes into, eg no drawers.

Reviews.Title: “Location is excellent, but hotel itself isn't so great”
Reviews.Author: Kingkandonia
Reviews.Content: I had researched this hotel before we went and was impressed with what I found, but when I got there I was a little disappointed. I don't really understand WHY this hotel is a 4 star, but it seems that every hotel in Rome is at least a 4 star! It was quite old fashioned in side and the rooms just never seemed fully clean. It's as if they could do with a good scrub down. The bathroom was particularly bad, it was the kind of thing I'd have expected on a self catering in Ayia Napa! I keep reading about the friendly staff, but in all fairness, we didn't really have to ever deal with the staff so I can't really comment. They didn't seem THAT friendly when we did deal with them though. The breakfast was ok, never stopped B&B before so got nothing to compare it to. There could have been a better selection of food though. And if you wanted anything cooked, you would have to pay extra. The only thing that got this hotel an "average" review was the location. For my first time in Rome, I was really happy with how close it was to everything. It was no longer than 15 minutes walk from Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. This made exploring really easy. We were close to many restaurants and bars so we got out of the hotel as much as we could. When we left, they charged us an accomodation tax. This isn't unique to this hotel, but we wasn't aware of it and we had to use our last few Euro's to pay. Bit annoyed that our travel agent hadn't made us aware of this or included it in our price. Overall, I would stay there again if the price was right. But it would be my last choice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappionted”
Reviews.Author: Happinesss
Reviews.Content: We thought this was suppose to be a four star hotel but in fact it was more like a 2 star. The elevator is super small they might as well not have it. But when your room is on the 3rd floor you need especially when traveling with an toddler. The rooms looked nice on line but we must have gotten an old one. Is was bad!! The location is a little off the center of Rome. And one night we were going to go to dinner at the hotel restaurant but oh they decided to close it that night with no advance notice to the guests. Who does that???

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: roy_morgan
Reviews.Content: A very friendly hotel and very clean. The staff are a great laugh and helpful. Its cheaper to eat in the hotel rather than eat out.Would jump at the chance to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely First Time Stay In Rome!”
Reviews.Author: LaBimmer
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Oxford was pleasant and in a good location. The staff was warm, polite and welcoming. The room was small but comfortable, since we were only there to sleep. However, the shower frightened me because there was nothing to hold onto and I was really afraid of falling, though I didn't. Breakfast was great and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, but...”
Reviews.Author: Robert K
Reviews.Content: I just took a trip to Rome with my family & we rented 4 studio apartments from the Hotel Oxford on Via Piave. The rooms were clean & attractive. We had a beautiful view of a quiet street where we could eat breakfast every morning. Maid service always seemed to be buzzing around if anything was ever needed. The water was really hot! The down side of the the room, for me, was the hard bed, and the shower. The way the single glass door in the shower was set up we found it impossible to take a shower without flooding the bathroom. We had no problem getting extra towels, but we just had extra wet towels to hang up every day. One of the 4 rooms had a view of a grungy alleyway. No irons are allowed in the rooms! The hotel staff was mostly helpful during our stay. All of our phones were out of order for 3 days which made things very difficult, because none of us brought cell phones to Italy. They were nice enough to lend us an alarm clock for a 5:30am wake up on our last day, but we never got any messages our entire stay. Including the one from our travel agent notifying us that our flight had been pushed back an hour & 45 minutes. Other guests we were with, who stayed in a separate Hotel Oxford apartment (whose phones were also out), had a note slipped under their door the night before. When we questioned the front desk as to why we didn't receive the same service they accepted no responsibility. They did even offer us breakfast or coffee for the extra 1:45 that we sat in the lobby waiting for our ride to pick us up.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel a little out the way”
Reviews.Author: Zoe23
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, as long as you are prepared to walk a good 20 minutes to get to the main sites (there are some buses though). The staff here are smiley and helpful, both at reception and at breakfast. We had a spacious room with a small balcony and a large sofa. There was also a fridge in the room which was handy for keeping drinks cool. The breakfast offers a lot of choice, and the rooms were thoroughly cleaned every day. The reception area has jugs of water and copies of British news.

Reviews.Title: “A good basic hotel if you are more interested in Rome than a posh hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ShihanUK
Reviews.Content: The Oxford was overall a good choice for the price. The room was clean, presentable and of a reasonable size when compared to many European small hotels. The Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain were about 20 minutes walk away which was no real problem. The Villa Borgese park is very close and great for relaxing with a book or hiring a bike when you have had enough of building gazing. The best thing about the hotel were the staff. Genuine smiles and helpfulness the whole of our stay from everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable, but nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: SKTT09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly fine, but if you are looking for a perfect place or something spectacular, look elsewhere. The room was clean, the bed was fine, airconditioning worked well, the breakfast was decent - no faults indeed but all of the basic good quality. The location a bit far from the major attractions, and from the metro as well - but close to some very nice local restaurants. I could not get internet to work in my room, but there is free wireless in the lobby. The staff are nice.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Roman Experience!”
Reviews.Author: CathyFerreri
Reviews.Content: What a delightful experience it was to stay at the Hotel Oxford in Rome for three nights and 4 days. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was a true Italian breakfast experience. The food available every morning (croissants, Italian bread toast, cheese, prosciutto, other cold cuts, yogurt, fresh fruit, fresh coffee, tea and pastries) was very good. My hotel room was quaint, clean and comfortable. I felt very safe walking along Via Boncompagni, Via Veneto to Piazza Barberini. The people in the shops and around the town were so friendly and eager to help with directions. I also booked 3 tours around Rome. The CitiTour shuttle from Greenline Tours picked me up every day at the hotel so I could tour the fabulous city of Rome. This was a great service. I experienced two wonderful meals at the Restaurant Eduardo three blocks away on Via Lucullo. The owner Eduardo and his staff were wonderful hosts. The hotel location was superb. Thank you to all the staff at Hotel Oxford in Rome. I look forward to staying with you again! Grazie

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elien91
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel is located in a nice neighourhood in Rome. The staff didn't understand English very well, which was sometimes annoying. Luggage was brought to the room by a bellboy, that was very nice. The elevator only went up to the 2nd floor, so if your room is on the 3rd floor you'll have to take the stairs. The room was nice and tidy, not very big but enough for a short stay. The bathroom was very clean and big enough, with a bidet. The breakfast was fine, but you have to pay for an omelet/scrambled eggs. Don't order your taxi at the reception because you will pay 10 € extra, which is probably just profit for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel although a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: TR_Abroad
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite nice with well appointed, though small rooms. The buffet breakfast was quite good and there was a lovely restaurant just around the corner called Brancaleone’s. It was a relatively easy walk from the hotel to the main train station where there plenty of buses for getting around and seeing the main sites, which was what we were in Rome to do. In hindsight however I would probably opt to say a little closer to the main attractions to reduce the amount of walking, particularly as we had children with us.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and courteous staff, free Wi-fi, room a bit of a disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: milliemilinka
Reviews.Content: On arrival the hotel looks fine from the outside. It is the staff that make this hotel not its ambience or decor! The reception area is okay but a bit dark and chintzy for my taste, although there is free wifi access in all the public areas including the dining room. The room we stayed in was reasonably clean, the bed quite comfy, and it had air conditioning which was a bonus. The decor was a rather bizarre covering of woven material dating back to the 70's (rather apt as we were in Rome to celebrate being 40!). The bathroom was clean enough and the shower powerful, however the cubicle arrangement was novel (a square shower tray with one sliding glass door and slither of shower curtain). This was a problem because the shower curtain blocked the plughole, leading to the shower tray overfilling and flooding the bathroom! Water then cascaded out down the step, under the odd sliding door arrangement in place and onto the carpet outside! Once we had established this was a hazard we took the required precautions and by stopping the shower to let the tray empty a couple of times, all was well. The breakfast was good, with plenty to choose from. The concierge staff were extremely helpful in booking restaurants for us and giving directions. They were happy to look after our luggage once we had checked out. The location of the hotel is a bit out of the way, but we were happy to walk anyway and it was in a reasonably quiet street so we didn't mind. If you are going to rely on public transport or cabs, I would recommend you try to find somewehere nearer the Pantheon/Piazza Navona as that is nearer the main sites.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Rome”
Reviews.Author: SteveC888
Reviews.Content: If you do not mind a 20 min walk to the main attractions in Rome (Spanish Steps etc) then this is a good value for you. All embassies are nearby so there are many pretty good foodies right in the area. There is a very nice residential area as well. So this may seem off the beaten path to some but it is not. You will not be in the lap of luxury here but you will not be disappointed either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Magda009
Reviews.Content: We travelled with the family (14 people). Hotel was nice, staff very helpful and friendly, rooms small but comfortable, we did not like one room-(too small), we were given different with the balcony, breakfast continental-plenty of food, good choices, Carlo-bartender very friendly, taking care of us. The only issue is that it is little to far from the main attractions, gooood walking distance everywere, you need comfortable shoes, We had a great time, would recommend it to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff, comfortable, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: KMGO55
Reviews.Content: All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was large and well equipped and spotless. Breafast was plentiful. The bar area was very relaxing. All in all a very pleasant stay and we would definitely return to this hotel. The taxi cost from airport to hotel is costly but i dont think this is the hotels doing as i'm sure there is a set charge city wide. Always check the price of your journey in any taxi as we were charged different prices for the same journey. Don't eat in the tourist areas, get off the beaten track and find local family run restaurants, the food is probably much better and more reasonably priced. Rome is a fasinating city, expensive but well worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed and wanted”
Reviews.Author: bedale_traveller
Reviews.Content: Good location for public transport as well as on foot. Easy access to tourist attractions. Beautiful park short walk away. Hotel comfortable, clean and well maintained, staff friendly and helpful, good breakfast, sandwiches etc in bar wholesome and nicely presented. Alternative eateries nearby to suit all tastes and pockets. Had no problem finding what we wanted. The bedroom and bathroom sizes for a central capital city hotel were what could be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TNT_Portsmouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this hotel as a first visit to Rome. What we didnt realise is how near to everything the location actually was. We upgraded our room and were grateful for that as other people did comment on the size of the room. We walked our socks off for 3 full days visiting all the local must see sights and thanks to a map provided by the hotel didnt get lost once. The food was good and resonably priced considering the price of restaurants with a view!

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: BoilermakersHump
Reviews.Content: This was a thoroughly enjoyable long weekend in Rome made (in part) by our stay at The Hotel Oxford. The room was a little "compact" but always beautifully cleaned. Without exception, the staff were all helpful and smiling - from the chamber maid to the Manager. We ate in the hotel on the first night and the food was very nice. We used the bar frequently and the bar staff (particularly Carlos) were always pleasant and efficient whether we wanted a Manhattan or just a cup of coffee. Thank you Hotel Oxford for making our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great find”
Reviews.Author: smtr550
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 3 nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The room was spotless and well equipped although a bit on the small side. Still we didn't spend much time in it to be fair so it wasn't a problem. Staff were really friendly and the bar offers a welcome relax after lots of sightseeing and shopping. The drinks prices and service are excellent. The location.also suited us with some good local restaurants right on the door step. I shall stay again on my next trip in April and can't wait to be back. Would recommend it to anybody. Well done the Oxford

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.....but not a four star”
Reviews.Author: london_traveller9
Reviews.Content: Location - Hotel is in a good location, about 10 mins walk to Termini Station, and within walking distance to most attractions. Colesseum is approximately 30 mins walk for a fast walker but worth the walk as there's so much to see en-route. There is a large supermarket about 5 mins walk but nothing much available on it's doorstep other than a few restaurants and a sandwich bar. Checking in - Staff were very attentive and helpful. On arrival the receptionist checked us in swiftly, gave us a map and talked us through all the main attractions and how to get there. He also gave us tips on where to eat, such as the Trastevere area which turned out to be a great recommendation! One note of caution, the map was at times very misinforming. We found some of the roads were incorrectly labeled which resulted in us frequently straying off track! Strangely enough the map seems to be handed out widely throughout Rome! We instead reverted to our Time Out guide book maps. Hotel and room - the hotel itself is definitely not a flashy four star. More like a top end three star. The decor is very cosy and comfortable throughout the hotel, at sometimes dated. Our room was a very good size for a standard room. Very spacious, clean with a large bed! The ensuite was fairly small but modern and clean. The rooms were cleaned daily and towels changed. The satellite TV has a good variety of channels covering many languages. Sleeping was not an issue, very quiet. However, a note of caution for less mobile travelers, the lift is absolutely tiny and it appears some of the floors are only accessible by stairs, very narrow and steep stairs, however staff did happily take our luggage up to our rooms for us. Breakfast in the mornings was average. Not hot food but good selection of cereal, breads, pastries, drinks and few cold meats and cheeses. One of our major issues was the fact that there was no iron of trouser press available as it is ‘against the hotel’s policy’ (in their own words). We were asked to use the laundry service which charged a premium! Highly recommend you take a travel iron. Overall, I think the hotel is great value for money and from my experience there are many hotels such as this in Europe which just scrape into the four star criteria but by no means are luxury. If you’re fussy then you’ll have to dig a little deeper into your wallet but otherwise recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff, great location & great service”
Reviews.Author: lydon1
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night city breal booked through british airways as a first trip abroad with our 7yr old son. The hotel staff were all very friendly, helpful & kind, especially so with our son! The room was very clean, serviced daily, very comfortable beds, very good tv/internet access & with an easy to use safe. The breakfasts where good with a wide choice e.g. cereals, juice, bread, cheese etc Its well placed to walk to all main sites in Rome & with easy walking distance of many resturants....one we visited had food to die for!! would definitely stay their again & would recommend it to our friends & relatives!

Reviews.Title: “manager and staff not very helpful”
Reviews.Author: judyg493
Reviews.Content: stayed for three nights with my family,we had two birthdays to celebrate while here,i asked the manager if we could have champagne on the last morning to celebrate them but he was so unhelpful telling me to see barman.this wasnt the only occasion, ie ordering a taxi for us,checking my return transfers,just found the staff very unhelpful and not friendly which is not what i read up before we went.the bar closes at 11pm if your lucky you may get a drink.carlos was friendly though.breakfast time was chaotic always waiting for teapots,teabags,couldnt get a cleancup one morning and the waitress again was very abrupt.i have never complained about an hotel before but just had to this time.we did have great time in rome just a pity we were let down by our stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “my Birthday trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: kdmiddleton50
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Rome. I stayed at the Oxford with my daughter. What a wonderful welcome we had. We could not have wished for a better place to stay.. The staff are very pleasant, especially the Bar staff. If there was a problem the staff were always happy to help. I would recomend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in Rome. You canget to anywhere from here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, but not four star quality”
Reviews.Author: SteveS1957
Reviews.Content: Nothing earth-shatteringly wrong with the hotel, but it most definitely does not stand up to its four star billing. Rooms are small, but otherwise comfortable, but the slightly run-down decor perhaps indicates a make-over is needed. Staff pleasant, but no great concern for quality of service. Good breakfast bar, but the restaurant isn't as attractive as the many surrounding cafes. The bar seemed quite popular each evening, although once again there is plenty of choice in the surrounding area. If you are wanting to visit Rome's main tourism sites however, then you hit the hotels main problem. It is literally out on a limb. Plan to expend a great deal of taxi money or shoe-leather. The nearest Metro station is a good 15 minutes walk. 'Sights' such as Spanish Steps or Collisseum are more than 30 minutes solid walking - in different directions - and it is uphill to get back to the hotel! The same hotel owners also have another property, the Hotel Regno, which is much better placed. It will get our business next time!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: SusanS33
Reviews.Content: This hotel was part of a three night package and we were very happy with the price, value, quality, location and service. Package included breakfast which was great. Staff were friendly and helpful. They also have great gelato. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: EriePeople
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Oxford was absolutely delightful! Nice room, excellent staff, delicious food. Hotel Oxford helped make our visit to Rome most memorable. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL OXFORD.........”
Reviews.Author: Jemima79
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have just returned from a stay at the most beautiful city in the world Rome!!!. We stayed at the Hotel Oxford and the hotel itself is amazing I can't fault it at all. Very clean and the staff were all friendly and very helpful. The breakfast was OK although i didn't think there was much choice, and they do have hidden charges. When they offer you eggs and bacon, ( eggs and fried ham!) it's not part of what you've paid for and they will sting you for it on departure. Then we come to dinner. This is the biggest flaw of the hotel and the only thing that in my view is bad. We stayed in the hotel for dinner on the second night. It's overpriced ( beyond overpriced if i'm honest) and the food is vile!. Tiarmasu ( sp) was made on the spot with "squirty" cream and was inediable, much like the steak that I order medium and was cold raw meat in the middle. The meat stated that it came with vegetables, what that actually meant was limp cold tasteless spinch underneath the meat with no potatoes. As i've said the hotel itself is lovely and in my view is worthy of the 4* it has gained, but the food is disgusting and really let's the overall stay down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: habibi17
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Oxford's location is excellent for walking to just about anywhere around Rome. Our room was a bit small but very clean with crisp white linens and fluffy white towels. The restaurant provided very nice breakfasts and a cozy delicious evening meal was enjoyed. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The front desk organized a shuttle to and from the airport plus a day tour for us which was so appreciated. We would end a busy day with a glass of wine and fun conversation in the Hotel Oxford's bar with Carlos the bartender. This was our second visit to the Hotel Oxford and would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy family hotel located where Romans actually live!”
Reviews.Author: MandySydney
Reviews.Content: I unexpectedly needed to be in Rome (I was already enroute from Australia) and my great travel agent (Mary Rossi Travel, Australia) found me the Hotel Oxford. Its located about a 20 minute walk from Via Condotti, via the Spanish Steps. This is not a glamourous hotel, but it is warm, clean and welcoming. As a solo traveller, its great that it has a small, friendly lounge where you can get a glass of wine, and an ok in house dining room (and room service). The hotel staff are super helpful, they cheerfully booked tours for me that were not on their standard list etc. There is a great resto next door, plus more up the road. And the kind of upmarket (but not scary) department store Rinacentere (sp?) is just a 5 minute walk. It was a little bit disappointing not to be in the thick of it ie Trevi Fountain ect, but on the other hand it was peacful. Also, it was no more than 10 to 15 Euro to get back to the Oxford Hotel from any of the tourist points in Rome. Also, the best breakfast of any 3 star I stayed in (I 'did' Rome, Venice and Florence) - lots of fresh food, variety, and best of all, you could boil your own eggs. So much better than all that congealed scrambled egg that everywhere else offers. Highly recommended for english speaking families, especially if you are driving (as there is a garage not far away). Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming hotel,excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: mattPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: Staff cant do enougth to ensure your stay in Rome goes smoothly. When we arrived at the hotel we were given a map and shown where we were, points of interest, transport links and restaraunts. The bar in the hotel is cosy and is a flash back to the 1980s. The 1980s music, Tears for fears and softcell playing in the background causes you to question which decade it is.Carlos the barman makes wierd and wonderful cocktails which was a daily highlight to end our days out in rome. The room we had was large, very clean and comfortable. The continental breakfast is fine, but the coffee is very strong. The evening meals are value for money but a bit bland. For paying an extra 20 euros you could get a better meal at one of the nearby restaraunts. The Hotel could do with a makeover, I think it must be a good 20 years since the interior has been decorated. However I think its current decor does add to its charm. I would stay at this hotel again, the service by the Staff is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is value for money, clean and in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: mrsharry007
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was nice, staff were helpful and location was good with many historic locations were in walking distance. The restaurant in the hotel is worth a visit, dinner was excellent on all occasions. Our room was large with a good size bathroom. Overall I would recommend this to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little place to stay while in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jedeguara
Reviews.Content: I took my wife and seven year old daughter for a couple of days break in Rome. The hotel while being nothing special was everything we wanted. The staff were polite and efficient, the room was clean and spacious enough, the breakfast was enough to get us started for a day of site seeing in this wonderful city. The bus/metro connections take you where you need to go and the villa borghese park was in walking distance. If you are expecting 5 star extravagance with a massive breakfast and rooms with all the trimmings, look elsewhere. This was not on our agenda however, and we would like to thank the management and staff for a lovely stay which we would gladly repeat some time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Worst room I ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Azita
Reviews.Content: After going thru check-in formalities, the hotel staff offered to take my luggage for me and guide me to my room. When I got to the elevator, it was so small that only 2 people could fit in! stopped at the fifth floor, and I was a bit surprised by the odd and tight corridor where the elevator's door opened to. not to mention the very old carpet that covered it! But I didn't know that the worst was yet to be seen - my room! The hotel staff opened the door only half, I guess because he didn't want to hit the bathroom door with the room door!!I stood there for a few seconds trying to digest the view in front of me. The bed's headboard and left-side was glued to the walls. I only had enough space to put my suitcase at the foot of the bed. that was the width of the space between the bed and the room wall. I could only 'walk' 1 step between the bed and the bathroom door (or the room door - since they were only 1 step away from each other). Other than that, the only space I had was the bed! I had not slept the night and had arrived at 8 am. So I didn't have the energy to go argue with reception for a room change. and I was going to check out next morning at 7 am. So I just took my personal bed sheet and thanked God more than once, that I had taken it with me in a last minute decision! the bed cover was so old that I was not sure I can touch it without tearing it. I certainly don't recommend this hotel to anyone. ever.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, pleasant and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: rld22
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, with very pleasant and helpful staff. However the rooms were rather variable. We were given a small room with a 140cm bed and a very small bathroom. After we had been taken to the room I asked if they had any rooms with a larger bed as I had expected a 4 star hotel would have a larger bed. They said they had nothing else available that night, but would move us next day. Well it was like chalk and cheese, the next room was much better and at least twice the size. The area was very quiet, but unfortunately the rooms had been renovated with hard floors so I was kept awake with the sounds of footsteps and people leaving at 4:30 am. But that may have been my problem, being a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “What a treasure in the sea of hotels in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug95051
Reviews.Content: We're still here but I just had to write a review while relaxing in the hotel bar. The stay here has been pleasant and enjoyable. The staff has been great! Manuela at the front desk, Simone and Stefano in then dining room and not to forget Carlo then barman. They all have been great and has made our stay a memorable one. The rest of the staff had been great too, but, I just can't remember their names at this time. I'd recommend staying here if you don't want to spend $300 per night on a room. It located near the major attractions and an easy hop on to the bus. Walking distance from the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Via Veneto, and the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel - perfect location and superb staff.”
Reviews.Author: cawoodsm
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter and we were extremely impressed with all aspects of the hotel as well as the location which is perfect - just off the Via Veneto. Our room was the largest one of our trip and the staff were really helpful and friendly. It also has a lovely restaurant and a great bar with the best bar-tender in Italy, Carlo! I will definitely stay at the Hotel Oxford when I return to Rome and have no hesitation referring it to everyone. Joanne Melbourne, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless room; friendly staff who are happy to meet your needs.”
Reviews.Author: NJBEssex
Reviews.Content: Stayed 26 Sept - 2 Oct 2010. In the quieter financial/embassy area, but only a short walk to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain or Villa Borghese (sublime art/sculptures). Our room (superior) was at the front of the hotel - good size and well appointed. It was cleaned thoroughly every day. If you are used to larger American sized rooms you would be advised to book a superior room. Our booking included breafast which proved excellent value for money; a buffet breafast with juice, cerial, fruit, cold metas + cheeses, rolls, croissants + pastries, coffee or tea. The restaurant is good. Set set dinner at 26€ was tremendous value for 4 courses. Restaurants in Rome are expensive - you will be paying 50€ a person before you know it! The staff speak good English and went out of their way to make you feel welcome. Brilliant stay - would definitely go back and will be before too long I hope.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: hagrant
Reviews.Content: The Oxford provided a superb vacation hotel for our spring hloiday. The first room we were shown was disappointing, but we were immediately and graciously transferred to an elegant front room, overlooking the street. We stayed for one week and each and every day, the room was refreshed and immaculate. The staff was friendly and courteous and offered many excellent suggestions when we planned our day trips. The closeness to the important sites was perfect. Our experience was just wonderful! We would highly recommend the Oxford to all our friends and hope to return again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: 186525Linda
Reviews.Content: just back from a weeks stay at the oxford with my partner,the hotel was lovely, very clean we were put in the wrong room to start with but they put us in another with no problems atall. the staff were very friendly and very helpful,sit at the bar and try carlos,s cocktails (fab) great barman very friendly,a bit of a walk from some of the sights once you find your bearings it,s fine, would certainly go back thanks alot you were all great.

Reviews.Title: “lovely, helpful,English speaking staff,safe and quiet location,”
Reviews.Author: flygirl_1085
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my 11 year old daughter and as I have travelled to Rome many,many times before on my own I was well aware how small hotel rooms are in Rome so I was fairly pleased with our Superior room. They are sound proofed so you do not hear outside noise and it is opposite the US Embassy and Italian banks so the area is safe and well-guarded. The bus to the train station is only one block away and costs one Euro so don't get taxis as they are too pricey. You can walk to The Spanish steps, Hard Rock Cafe, a fantastic park full of fountains which comes alive at night with motorised tandems, miniature train rides, bikes to hire,outdoor cinemas etc and the Spar shop is just off Tuscana which is 4 blocks away to buy drinks and picnic items. Diet coke is 0.70 Euro, water 0.45 Euro!There is a safe and fridge in the room so we stocked up on drinks for each day. The open air bus is a fantastic way to see all the sights as you can hop on and off all day long and headphones are given to you to listen to the history of each building or obolisk you pass. The price online for the bus is the same in UK as in Rome. The staff are really lovely and went out of their way to look after us. No amount of questions were too many and I am baffled on the comments about poor cleanliness as our room was always spotless. The cleaner was lovely. The buffet is substantially Continental even though it states FULL on the BA website. BA's error not the hotel's. You only need one bottle of water in Rome as there are fresh drinking fountains absolutely everywhere to keep topping up at all sights, parks and most main streets. Catch the Leonardo Express from FCO airport to Rome Station at 15Euro per adult, children are free. No need for expensive transfers. Take good shoes as the cobbles are too much for sandals and flip flops. We bought cheap Primark converse and chucked them at the end of our really enjoyable week at the Oxford. Hopefully a fantastic holiday experience for my daughter to remember for a lifetime whilst the husband and son camped in the rain in Devon!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the friendly staff and room cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: 5salina
Reviews.Content: This was altogether an excellent hotel for an older, single, female traveler. The food in the restaurant was excellent (menu is posted early in the day and you can choose to eat there or not -owner and his charming mother often are seen there dining - the wait staff at breakfast and dinner both are GREAT)! (The restaurant/nightclub immediately next door, however, is NOT recommended - people there were young, rude, and the food was not in any way exceptional, but there are other good restaurants not far away, should that be your choice). My room was "run-of-the-house", an added incentive since those rooms are less expensive; mine was small, but very nice, clean and very quiet. The bartender (hope he's still there) was superb and the bar can/ did serve a wonderful caprese salad at off hours. The surroundings are safe and the buildings across the street are most beautiful. There is even a street cat who lives not too far down the block. I sat at the small tables just outside the hotel with a glass of wine and enjoyed watching mothers accompanying their children home from school and the plethora of Vespas going back and forth. When I was there, internet access had a small charge, but the computer was conveniently located in the lobby. (Instead of getting a taxi from the airport, one can get the Leonardo Express from the airport to Rome Central train station, and then a cab on to the hotel - it's not that far). Between the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps there is an alleyway used to go back and forth between the two with several restaurants located on it. The restaurant (both outside and inside tables) nearest the Trevi Fountain has a "greeter" outside who will delight visitors to Rome - highly recommend seeking him out, which is easy to do - he strikes up conversations with passersby all the time and makes lunch people-watching great fun! Also highly recommend the Oxford Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elizartist
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Oxford in Rome. Dumpy and sorely in need of renovation. Cons: tiny rooms with beds and pilllows hard as rocks, dirty carpeting/ Pros A/C, nice staff, liked the location, decent breakfast. Would look elsewhere if visiting Rome again.,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: bostonkse
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the first portion of my trip to Italy. I shared a room with my cousin for 3 nights. The room was VERY clean and was pretty typical to what you'd expect in Europe. The service was excellent, from the lobby desk to the bartender. A complimentary breakast is offered daily (it was delish!). Although not too close to things, it's a quick cab ride for less than 20 euro. We were able to walk to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain just fine. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel & great staff”
Reviews.Author: PSUgirl98
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Oxford. The staff was very friendly & helpful. They are not as centrally-located to the major sites, but you can easily walk everywhere if you're willing. The hotel provides you with great maps of the city and we used it throughout our trip. The breakfast is good and the rooms are nice. The free internet in the lobby/salon was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “an okay hotel made better by excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: johncolescarr1
Reviews.Content: First off, this is not a 4 star quality hotel, its more like 3. However the staff are excellent, efficient, attentive, discreet and are 5 star. The hotel is conveniently located, 5 mins taxi from station with many of Rome's attractions walking distance. Its a fairly small hotel and our room was pretty small and a bit tired, but impeccably clean, daily cleaning was of high standard. The room insulation was outstanding, 3 nights of great sleep even though busy road outside and we were at the front. The bar was very good and we actually used it every night for a drink after our meal. Prices were sensible and cocktails very good. The barman was brilliant and really made the bar, attentive but discreet and made a real effort with the snacks supplied with the drinks. Breakfast was mediocre, but okay. Coffee horrible, ask for cappuccino or espresso instead. Not sure what the price was as we booked as part of a multi stop tour with Thomas Cook but compare to 3 star venues. Tried the hotel restaurant on 1st night, was okay but not great, but sensible price, recommend la cantina but ster clear of il bite, horrible, dirty pizzeria around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Should be a 3 star really”
Reviews.Author: tcc
Reviews.Content: First off I'll get the negative stuff out of the way. - When we arrived at our (room 124) it was tiny! The bathroom only had a shower and not a bath (smallest shower in the world!) The queen size bed was along one wall with a mirrored wall on the opposite side, with the TV on the same side as the bed!? Difficult to watch any TV (good job we didn't want to). However after realising how small this room was we noticed a tray with a half drunken cup of coffee with a couple of croissants and 3 packets of light bulbs! We complained about this straight away and the Manager waived the fee for our late snack in the bar. I should have asked to change the room but it was late and we both very tired. - I was also a bit disappointed with the Breakfast. I booked because it said Full breakfast was included, however it doesn't include HOT items, this you have to 4EUR extra. They bring out your Tea or Coffee and then you can help yourself to cereals, croissants, pastry, bread rolls and you can help yourself to orange juice. Okay onto the positives, location wise it's a 10 min to Via Veneto which has plenty of restaurants which can be pricey, further down towards Barberini there are some shops and more in the side streets which are well worth a look. We had dinner one of the evenings at the hotel and it was absolutely delicious and very good value! We had Antipasti to start, I had sliced Steak with some parmesan while my wife had Mozzarella and parma ham. Both were excellent. The main meal we both had pasta (I think cannelloni) and that was excellent as well. With both anti pasti, main meals and two drinks the bill was 34EUR, excellent value! The other positive was the waiter at the bar, very good and spoke good English and gave us very good service each evening we were there. Overall I probably wouldn't stay here again simply because of the price. My tip is if you get room 124 or any other room that seems ridiculously small then ask for another room, the pictures show larger standard rooms so ask for one of them! As for Rome itself it's a gorgeous city and we wouldn't hesitate to go back, I will do a review of the trip on the forum in due course. Any questions about the Hotel just PM me and I'll get back to you. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, in this quiet comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsHCambridge
Reviews.Content: This was a good deal through BA though cancelled once when we finally arrivede we were pleasantly surprised. Small but compact and extremely clean. Helpful staff in all areas of the hotel. We would definately consider staying here again this was our first visit to Rome. Nothing really to do with the hotel but why when the tap water in Rome is grand do they try and tell you its against the law to give you a jug of it with your meal ?

Reviews.Title: “Good position,clean & friendly”
Reviews.Author: Simmo58KentUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Oxford during the last week of March 2010. Having read previous reviews we decided that this was agood deal as we got 5 nights for the price of 4 and had free upgrade to 'superior' rooms! Having pre booked a private cab from the airport, at a cost of 45 euros we arrived at the hotel after a 45 minute journey from Fumicino airport. The reception is pleasant and the staff were very friendly. Despite receiving an upgrade to 'superior' rooms we were allocated very small pokey rooms, one on the first floor and one on the second. Previous reviews concerning the very narrow stairway were completely true and yes the lift only goes to the second floor! The rooms both backed on to a central nondescript area which made the rooms very dark. Having said that we spent little time in the rooms so we weren't unduly bothered, and they were clean and tidy. I reported a faulty shower head to recption on our first evening and it was replaced whilst we were out. The reception staff were able to reccommend some very good restaurants within walking distance and the two that we ate at were superb, the taverna Flavia and La Pentolaccia.We had also pre booked a trip to Naples and Pompeii which meant we had to leave the hotel at 06:30 and despite being told that we would be able to have breakfast before we had to do without as they wouldn't let us in until 06:45!! These were minor irritations and did not spoil our stay at the Oxford. We would stay here again but stipulate larger rooms next time.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and cosy”
Reviews.Author: jopaca
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in this hotel when going to Rome, makes me feel somewhat at home

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff near everything in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Limafoxtrot16
Reviews.Content: This hotel and its staff were our first experience in Rome and Italy. The quaint hotel seemed to be near everything - good dining, shopping, historic sites, the U.S. Embassy - all in easy walking distance. The rooms were small - typical for many older European properties - but clean and cozy, offering a great place to relax after walking all day to see the city. Even though the windows overlooked a main street the noise was minimal and all in all the room was great. The hotel staff was amazingly helpful - coordinating alternate plans when our travel companies bus never showed up to take us to our tour. They also gave great recommendations on dining, shopping and near by attractions. The restaurant in the Hotel Oxford is probably one of the best hotel restaurants I have ever eaten at, and a great restaurant in and of itself. Wine prices were some of the best we found in Rome - with bottles being 10-20% less than the same bottle elsewhere with the added bonus that if you did not finish, they'd keep it for your next meal. The food was outstanding as well - all fresh and expertly prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mossybites
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is ideally situated for all the sites of Rome. Clean and friendly, good value and staff very helpful. I do agree with another reviewer that the staircase was perculiar but it did not detract from our enjoyment. Trevi Fountain, Spanish steps, colloseum all within a twenty minute walk, with history around every corner don't bother with the metro. Rome buses very good value, but if you walk there is so much to see and experience.

Reviews.Title: “Next time I visit Rome I will definitely be staying at the Hotel Oxford”
Reviews.Author: grahamree
Reviews.Content: Reception staff very helpful. Daniele the barman is excelent. If I was to make any criticism at all it would be about the quality of the orange juice at breakfast. It was not very tasty. I just cannot think of anything else to criticise. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Beebs75
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean rooms, reasonably priced. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “compact, comfortable,clean and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: lilmrsann7
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday (25th Jan)after a brilliant weekend. Travelled with my husband and my parents.We stayed in rooms 222 and 224, both medium sized and really nice, accessed by narrow stairs or small lift and along narrow corridor.(222had the nicer decor), the only thing missing was a kettle!!Take a travel kettle but be aware there was only one electric socket available above the bed! Room service is available. The bathroom was well equipped, shower small for my 6'2" husband( don't drop the soap!!) but ample for weekend use. Clean sheets and towels daily,extra blankets and pillows available. Breakfast was simple but plenty of it with very attentive staff ,no fresh bread on a Sunday tho so no nice crusty rolls! Didn't have meal at restaurant so can't comment. Reasonable prices at bar. The hotel is in a quiet road and is a little further away from attractions than originally thought, 20-30 mins from trevi fountain, pantheon and spanish steps, don't forget you spend hours walking around the attraction itself!! Taxi from hotel to Vatican 10 euros, to Colosseum 9 euros. well worth getting tour guide for both of these but shop around the touts. Turn left out of hotel then 1st left again for 4 local restaurants only ate at one pizza was really good! Airport transfers also booked through hotel, very reliable, nice cars.

Reviews.Title: “Safe area and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kap0011
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and had a very helpful staff. They arranged transportation by van from the airport to the hotel for a reasonable price. We were able to communicate with all the staff and had no problems explaining what we needed. The hotel is in a fairly residential area but had neighborhood restaurants nearby along with bars and wine shops. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly, was perfectly fine”
Reviews.Author: felixc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Oxford for almost a week. The staff were very friendly and the service was fine. Only con was that the TV was not working due to the conversion to digital cable and the room did not have wi-fi. The only caveat is that we were stayed in a two-bedroom apartment managed by the hotel. We didn't stay in the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “was just ok”
Reviews.Author: m_demetriou
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very basic, rooms quite small and style & decor needs updating. Staff were helpful and friendly. Continental breakfast was basic also. Cooked breakfast was charged even in all inc deals. Taxi required to get to most sights. wouldnt go there again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise...”
Reviews.Author: Frankie066
Reviews.Content: We arrived at a narrow street where the hotel is. As we walked in we noted that the lobby is very small. The lady at the reception checked us in, she was friendly and helpful. She then showed us our room. We normally carry our own luggages but the lady told us that someone would carry them up for us. As we were both exhausted after the long flight we weren't going to argue. As it turned out, the lift was so small that it wouldn't fit us and the luggages in at the same time anyway. As the lift only goes up to the 2nd floor, we had to walk up to the 3rd floor where our room was. We had to walk through narrow corridor and staircase to reach our room. We were both thinking how small would the room be. To our surprise, the room was clean and very spacious. One of the most spacious rooms we had during our entire trip. We had drinks and dinner at the hotel one night. The bartender was friendly and the food was good but not great. The hotel is not located where the actions are. That said, it's within walking distance to the Piazza di Spagna (the Spanish Steps) and Stazione Termini. Overall a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Quiet”
Reviews.Author: NFalmouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It is in an excellent location to get to all the wonderful attractions that Rome has to offer. The immediate location has a lot of great small family neighborhood places to eat. The only meal we ate at the hotel was the breakfast buffet it had everything you need. The food was all fresh and was open from 7AM to 10AM. Decaf Coffee is not a problem for this hotel. The woman waitress at breakfast is very friendly and willing to do anything to be helpful. The room was small but it had everything that is required. Bed and bedding was good, room was clean, bathroom was larger than expected and it was spotless! Real shower with great water pressure. Windows opened to a court yard so there was no street noise that you might find in the front of the hotel. We were with two other couples and one of them had stayed there before and was happy to be there again. I think this says a lot about the hotel. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic - the best hotel I stayed at during my one month trip.”
Reviews.Author: JLP277
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Oxford and plan to stay there again next time I visit Rome. The staff were fantastic - all staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. All front desk and restaurant spoke English and were very patient when I tried to speak Italian! The rooms were thoroughly cleaned daily and each was air-conditioned with individual controls per room. My first room (I stayed for a week then came back a week later for a single night) looked into a courtyard whilst my second room was over the main entrance and, thanks to double glazing, both were very quiet and I wasn't aware of any street noise at all during my stay. There was an excellent deal on as much internet and movie/tv access as you needed (12 euro for 24 hours). I was overseas on a research trip, so internet access was very important and other hotels I stayed at in Florence, London and Cardiff were very disappointing in this regard by comparison. During my stay I ate in the restaurant and had room service and was very happy with both in terms of cost, presentation and qualiy. In fact, I stayed at Hotel Oxford for six nights in total and ate at the hotel every night of my stay. The hotel itself is within walking distance from the train station (even with a massive suitcase) and served as a fantastic base. I walked everywhere during my week in Rome and, although Hotel Oxford isn't right in the middle of things, it wasn't difficult to get around on foot. Via Veneto was just down the street and it took about 10 to 15 minutes to meander to the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. The Vatican was about a 45 minute walk but that was with lots of stopping off to take photos, buy gelati, etc! All in all, I loved staying at the Hotel Oxford and plan to return to Rome (and it) in early 2011. I would recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: DavidScotGlasgow
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Hotel Oxford. It is set in a quiet location but is only minutes away from the busy Via Veneto. Nearby is the trevi fountain and the Piazza Barbarini( Which also has a Metro Station for the other destinations.) The room was lovely and the service was great. Everyone spoke English. We can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “A Bit of a Trek, But Worth It”
Reviews.Author: max761
Reviews.Content: For people who don't like to walk too far, this hotel is slightly out of the way after a long day sightseeing, but is close enough not to make it a major problem. Room was fine, and spotlessley clean - it seems like the sheets were changed every day. Bathroom good, and a nice selection of toiletries. The bar area was comfy, but a bit dark, and service friendly. The only gripe we had about our entire stay here was the breakfast, which served stale rolls, and the cereal had been left out, it seemed for days - a bit chewy. We didn't try the dinner there, due to the fact it was served in a windowless room without much charachter, so couldn't comment on the quality, but there are five or six places a couple of hundred yards up the street to choose from. All in all, a good find, and will likely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel - lots of walking needed to visit sights”
Reviews.Author: letsgo25
Reviews.Content: book your tickets for attractions/sights you wish to visit on line before going to rome will save hours of time queing when you get there.

Reviews.Title: “The tiniest room I ever seen!!”
Reviews.Author: PhilJoseph
Reviews.Content: The room is not bigger than a match box. One small bed and 4 walls, that (almost) all. You cannot open the door if the closet is open, the bathroom is minuscule. Overall the hotel looks old but it is functional if you're not clostrophob

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: Katterina
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very smal. Located in the center of Rome in the "hotel" area, as there are a lot of hotels arount. Not for from it is a police department, Hard Rock cafe and sub way. I stayed in a single room and was very surpriced how smal it was. It was for sure for one person, but I was much more surprised, when found bathroom in the closet. That was strange. But in general, room was clean, nice and with comfortable bad. Dispite bathroom was smal, it was working properly and had everything needed to feel comfortable. This hotel is good to stay for a budget trip with good comfort.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly, helpful staff, room nice size and comfy”
Reviews.Author: steviez
Reviews.Content: Overall pleasant stay. Staff at front desk was VERY friendly and helped us in many ways. Bar staff was nice too. Breakfast staff was so so, but ok. The bathroom needed some work and it's door wouldn't close all the way. AC was a little week, but after our horrible experience at Venice's Santa Chiara, this was paradise. We even got a little "tour" of the hotel with some interesting information about it's history when we checked in. Not far from Metro, down the street from US embassy and cool tree lined street with a couple very nice restaruants near the embassy. Internet available on a very old, but updated CPU, or in your room, but we couldn't down load any pictures. No port on the CPU. Impressed by 2 helpful men at the desk who waved at us when we passed thru the lobby and asked how the evening ,they helped us set up, went.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, rock hard bed, no tv, not close to anything much.”
Reviews.Author: kcvtraveler
Reviews.Content: The room was untolerably small and uncomfortable and luckily we didn't spend much time there. We had booked a quad for four of us and received three tiny rock hard beds and an additional cot with bedding as the fourth! The tv didnt work properly and only got one channel in English anyways when it did. The front desk staff was somewhat friendly and helpful in contrast to the lady at the bar area who was NOT. The saving grace to the whole stay was the breakfast buffet which was surprisingly well done and varied. There are no hot cooked foods however there was a nice spread of fruits, juices, yogurts, cereals and pastries. The hotel iS within walking distance of some nice restaurants and shops IF you don't mind hiking quite a long ways.
