Reviews.Title: “Good area, good staff, small room”
Reviews.Author: AussiesInEurope
Reviews.Content: At first we were concerned about this hotel because the room was quite small and the bathroom even smaller. The view was of a courtyard & all the other windows of rooms around us which wasn't really appealing. The bed was very comfortable which made up for a lot after some of the beds we've slept on in Europe. A big let down was that there was renovations being done right outside our window every morning starting about 8am but this is only a temporary problem which i'm sure won't go for long. After the first night we started to realise the value of this hotel as it had free internet in the lobby, it was very well located in a safe area of Rome about 2 minutes drive from the Termini and 15 minutes from the spanish stairs. All other attractions were within about 30 - 45 minutes walk from the hotel which isn't really that long when you've got such good scenery along the way. If you prefer not to walk you could catch a bus pretty much outside the hotel to anywhere you needed to go or cabs were extremely handy around the area. Most of the staff were very pleasant and what made our stay at this hotel worthwhile. We enjoyed our chats with the barman (Stefano) who was funny, helpful and very generous with snacks while you drank at the bar. Anna, Simona and Fabio were great in the restaurant and made you feel very comfortable at dinner. If your italian isn't up to scratch they were able to speak sufficient English to understand and help you with your dinner selection and tourist questions. Other guests we met at the hotel have been staying there for up to 5 years which we thought was a good sign of great hospitality and service by the hotel of a long period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, very helpful staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: TravelNutt69
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a hotel with friendly staff that was within walking distance to as many of the sights as possible. The staff was very helpful and friendly and exceeded expectations. Our room was typical for Europe (small) but it was very clean and had a private bathroom. Of the three hotels we stayed in while in Italy this was the only one that provided new bathroom supplies on a daily basis, provided slippers, did the best job cleaning the room and had the best continental breakfast. If you're looking to stay within walking distance to most of the sites, this place is great IF you're accustomed to walking decent distances (we live in New York City and we walk everywhere, so we have no problem walking 30-45 minutes to get somewhere). You can walk to the Spanish Steps in about 15 minutes, Vatican in 45 and Colloseum in about 40. If you're not a walker, this hotel may not be the best for you unless you're planning to take taxis or public transportation to most places (the nearest Metro stop is about a 10-15 minute walk).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poppy006
Reviews.Content: Situated in a superb position for sightseeing. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms maybe a little on the small side, but beautifully clean. Would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: KevinPBridgend_Wales
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely three night stay to watch the Wales vs Italy rugby international. The staff were very pleasant and welcoming. The hotel was very clean, but the rooms were small. I would recommend this hotel if you are more concerned about people and service rather than room size.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely suprise!!”
Reviews.Author: SugarandSpiceLondon
Reviews.Content: My other half booked a three night stay in Rome for my birthday with City Breaks as a suprise - I was over the moon when he told me. The only downside was that on checking Trip Advisor the hotel we were staying at sounded awful. I managed to get the Hotel changed to The Oxford for an extra charge and hoped that it was at least an improvement on what we had originally booked. We were both so pleased when we arrived. The Hotel itself is clean and bright - the rooms are spacious, clean & comfortable. The bathroom seemed new and the shower was fantastic. With so much to see in Rome we spent most of our time out but did find that the Hotel bar prices were much more reasonable than anywhere else in the city so found ourselves finishing our evening there rather than spending more money elsewhere. The Hotel was situated in a quiet area and although it looked a little further out on the map it was in easy walking distance of all the places of interest. I would definately recommend this Hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “I haven´t been annoyed like that for a long time”
Reviews.Author: PraguePet
Reviews.Content: I was planning a trip to Rome for a weekend as a leisure tourist. Based on ratings and recommendations I have decided to book hotel Oxford. And I must say that they really surprised me very negatively as they showed how they treat their clients. While making the reservations on their website I took a note that they are having special promotion: "If you find a lower price than ours tell us with the following form and we guarantee an extra discount to the lower price." So I did check with trip advisor and I found that on venere.com they are offering the price per room cheaper for more then 20 EUR. So I have made the reservation in the hotel applying for the discount as per their promotion. And what do you think they did? They made the reservation with the "old price" and changed the prices at www.venere.com and so they did not fulfill what they are promoting at their webpages. I have complained and I am in email touch with them as I am in the travel business and if there is something we are fighting against as travel agents then it is treatment of the hotels like that. So I made reservation in another 4* hotel in Rome because if they treat you like this since the beginning why should I stay there?

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, small and friendly hotel - fantastic trip”
Reviews.Author: JE99
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a brilliant 5 nights in Rome, staying at the Hotel Oxford. The hotel itself is relatively small, but plenty big enough, if you know what I mean. The rooms are average sized and very clean and comfortable. The bathrooms were well equipped, and again kept very clean every day, and the shower was invigoratingly powerful if you wanted it to be! The double bed was of a good large size and comfortable and the room generally had nice ambience. The only downside was, at least in our first floor room, the traffic noise at night/early morning was audible from buses etc. Although not a busy or noisy area and not really noticeable in the day, in the dead of night when you're trying to sleep I was awakended by passing large traffic occassionally. A set of 4 euro ear plugs put paid to this though and we slept soundly after this. Maybe I'm just a light sleeper. The hotel food was excellent, and the restaurant was far better value than any nearby restaurants, particularly wine, which was half the price. We had a couple of evening meals there and these were lovely, excellent value for money and standard. A beer is 3.50 euros and wine 12 euros a bottle. Pasta dishes were around 8 euros typical. Breakfast was typical choice, nice selection of cereals, croissants, rolls, ham and cheeses and fruit. Choice of coffee or teas. Certainly good enough for us. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is run by the same small group of hard working people every day. The barman was friendly and the atmosphere was that of a family environment. The bar was a nice place to relax in the evenings after dinner with a wide selection of drinks, nice ambience, and like I said, good value for money. Location You need to turn right out of the hotel to walk towards central Rome and its atttractions. On our first exploration to get our bearings we mistakenly turned left and walked for ages without finding anything nice or significant! Via Veneto is 5 minutes walk and this has some nice pavement restaurants and a Hard rock cafe. We eat in Il Peperone twice and Ciao Bella, which is at the bottome of Via Veneto. Both were nice meals, but the drinks were very pricey, particulay compared to the hotel bar. 25 euros typical for a bottle wine, and 8 euros for a small beer. Needless to say we drank water in the restaurants and saved our alcohol for the hotel bar! No meal cost more than 40 euros for the two of us, that was generally two courses. To reach the main attractions of Rome you need to turn right out the hotel, and walk along Via Boncompagni which becomes Via Ludovisi (after crossing Via Veneto). A left at the end of the road followed by the next right will bring you to the top of the Spanish Steps. This all takes about 15 minutes. This is the fastest and shortest route to the rest of the main attractions, the Pantheon and Trevi fountain are within 10 minutes from here. We walked to the Coliseum from the Hotel in around 40 minutes (along Via XX Settembre), and walked to the Vatican from the hotel in under an hour, which we did twice. The walking made the holiday because it was a great way to see the city, and there is so much to see as you go. I guess to start with I thought we were further away than I was expecting, but this ended up a blessing. If you want to be right on the doorstep of everything though then you may find it a little far out due to the 15 minutes to reach the Spanish steps. Warning - Taxis. The hotel is only a 15-20 minute walk from Termini train station, whilst carrying a case. This didn't stop the taxi costing 30 euros when we arrived, and this was apparently on the meter! My guess is he took us the long way, but if you're game, the hotel is easily walkable from Termini, and we walked on our return journey in 20 mins - well worth saving 30 euros. I might have got unlucky with the driver though, but it's impossible to agree a price up front as they say its on the meter - which was meant to be reassuring! Rome itself was brilliant, the attractions were all they were cracked up to be and more. Inside the Vatican was probably the highlight, particulary going up to the top of St Peters Basilca, incredible views, plus while your there you can see inside the top of the cupola. If you can, walk everywhere, far cheaper and you get to see and experience so much more. All in all a great break in a great hotel. Just remember those earplugs if you sleep light!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Oxford”
Reviews.Author: BonJovi123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel oxford during the rome section ofour european trip. We rented one of the hotel's apartments which is located approx. 100 - 200m away from the actual hotel. The service at the hotel was absolutely fantastic. The hotel provides wireless internet access as well as a desktop/stand-alone computer and printer that can be used for a small charge (eg - 3 euro for 30mins). The hotel's restaurant is no less than excellent and has great service and food with reasonable prices. The hotel, as well as offering hotel rooms, also offers some private apartments to rent. Our group of 6 consisting of 3 adults and 3 children - 15, 13, 12 stayed in a three room apartment. Each room had a private bathroom and comfortable beds. The apartment building is located only roughly 100 - 200m away from the hotel oxford and is quite secure. It has an elevator and there are a few choices of apartments for hire. Being only a short distance from the hotel, it is close to the hotels internet access, restaurant/bar etc. It is located in the central areas of Rome and is only approx. 10 - 15mins from repubblica/termini stations. Two supermarkets are close by as well as a laundrymat and the main roman street of Via Veneto with its many restaurants and boutiques. Over all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Rome at the hotel oxford and would return and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: VanessaParker
Reviews.Content: On our annual weekend away, we chose to go to Rome this year. As a travel agent, I have booked the Oxford hotel many time for clients. We found it a great little hotel. The walk to attractions was not a problem - after all - how else do you see a city, but it was so quiet at night - a real bonus when you return after a hard day's sightseeing. Breakfast adequate, rooms comfortable. Would certainly return there, as would my friends. Plenty of restaurants round about, if you did not want to use the hotel restaurant, which we did on the first night, but the second night we tried one just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Small friendly, recently refurbished 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gandhiji
Reviews.Content: The Oxford is a small, but friendly hotel. All the staff were very helpful and polite. The hotel looked as though it had only recently been refurbished. The hotel is small, consequently the bedrooms are on the smaller side but clean and comfortable. The complimentary breakfast is cold but varied and filling; a hot breakfast is available at extra cost. The bathroom was clean and prestine, but there was no bath; just a shower cubicle. The maid service was excellent. We had minor problems with the room card keys but they were quickly fixed. The hotel provided complimentary maps of Rome which were invaluable for sightseeing. The hotel is fairly centrally located but not really within walking distance of any of the major attractions. The nearest attraction is the Spanish Steps which is about half an hour walk. The nearest metro station is a 15 minute walk, but there are frequent buses from the nearest bus stop which is only five minutes away. The buses take between 15 and 30 minutes to centre of Rome. I would have preferred to have stayed at a hotel closer to the historic part of the city. Overall, a very good hotel which I am more than happy to recommend to any tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property”
Reviews.Author: mspi5
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure to spend 3 nights at the Hotel Oxford during a business trip to Rome. my local travel agent strongly recommended this property, as she had stayed there herself, and i am glad i took her advice. The room was clean, spacious, with all the amenities i could ask for. it looked like it had been recently renovated, and i was glad to find a high-speed internet connection in my room, a luxury that i didnt find in many other hotels in Rome. The staff was very polite and friendly, making my stay very enjoyable, and the restaurant was a pleasant surprise. Above all, the hotel was great value for money, and i truly recommend it to everyone travelling to the "Eternal City"...

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hilsurrey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights in this hotel as a romantic break. I decided to go there on recommendation of some friends who had stayed there. We did not regret it and had a wonderful time. The location is ideal, just off Via Veneto, in one of Rome's most glamorous quarters and with very good access to transport, restaurants and shops! Upon arrival the staff were very professional, friendly and helpful. The room was very nice and clean, and although is wasn't one of the largest I have been in, it was very comfortable and well serviced. The night we arrived we had dinner at the restaurant where the service was impeccable and the food (we had fish) simply delicious. Overall it is a very nice environment, ideal for someone who wants to relax. I was very sorry we only stayed 2 nights and I hope we'll be going there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation as always!”
Reviews.Author: nailuney
Reviews.Content: Totally loved the location of this hotel. Walking distance to Via Veneto and a few other trendy locations. Located on Via Boncompagni (adjoining Via Veneto) and not an alley as another user suggested. I have been utilizing the services of this hotel for many years and never once have I ever been dissaponted with the cleanliness of the rooms or the friendly efficient service of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean little hotel, nothing amazing, just somewhere to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaRhonda
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel (we got a quad room as there was four of us - 2 adults 2 children) was very narrow and small...The bathroom was really really tiny but we managed. It was a pleasant looking room with a window overlooking the terrace which was nice. Breakfast was okay, the breads, cheeses and hams were nice, variety wasn't huge but cleanliness was pretty good. Front desk staff weren't extremely friendly or helpful...looked like they were there just to do their job and thats all. Location was ok, you had to walk a while to get to the main tourist part through back streets. I would hate to imagine what size rooms the normal rooms are as we thought the quad room was extremely small. Overall, this hotel is ok but would try look for a better hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: hollybrighton
Reviews.Content: we have just got back from hotel .stayed 13th to 15th June 08 really friendly staff especially bar and breakfast .rooms are adequate for wekend stay' far enough away from tourist area for restuarants at reasonable prices (for Rome ) hop on hop off bus stop not too far away which we used and found to be the best way to get around well worth considering and if we went back we would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Hopeless”
Reviews.Author: Treborleo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked as I had stayed there before - great location and nice hotel. However I booked in January 2007 for my 6 night stay in August, received booking confirmation. On my arrival at 10pm I was told that they had overbooked and that there was no room available!!!! They did say I could have alternate accommodation in an apartment around the corner and pop over to the hotel for our breakfast - NO WAY. They then offered alternate accommodation at their sister hotel - Hotel Regno on the Via Del Corso - best thing that could have happened - better location and better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “happy days”
Reviews.Author: johnny4444
Reviews.Content: i spent 4 nights here with my 11year-old daughter.... i can not praise highly enough the excellent staff, who were at all times very friendly, kindly and caring the room was tidied each day to to an exceptinally high standard, and all clothes we had lazily strewn about were folded neatly by the cleaning staff mr.pippo guiliano was a gracious, amusing, kind, and generous host.... my daughter warmed very much to him and his amusing stories at dinner my daughter thought all the hotel staff were fantastic... they were all so kind and friendly to her, the sterotype of italian culture honouring and appreciating children clearly holding water i would recommend this hotel to all... it is ideally located, it is clean, friendly, and most welcoming .... we can't wait to go back the staff smile the tartuffo cioccolata/limone is not to be missed thank you

Reviews.Title: “a long walk”
Reviews.Author: JudeYuill
Reviews.Content: OK hotel, but a good walk from the first real Roman sites. I would choose to be more central as when you've been walking around all day that last walk home was just too far! Really clean and well decorated room. As you'll read here from other reviewers - the bathroom was TINY which was fine to start with but after 4 nights it became a little annoying. We had problems with our TV for two nights which took some sorting - if you are determined not to be ignored! Breakfast was as expected in Europe, but the same every day, no change at all. We stayed for one evening meal which was actually awful and if we weren't so tired from the walking we would have gone some where else. The staff were run off their feet and so a little short tempered. I think I might have mistaken their efficiency for rudeness at times. When we arrived at the airport we were going to get the train but managed to get a hotel hopper which dropped us direct to our hotel for the same price (11 euros each). So keep your eyes peeled for this when making your way to the station! We got a taxi back to the airport at the end of the stay for 55 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Most Excellent”
Reviews.Author: MarcClarke
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Oxford for 4 nights in March on the whole it was very good. To start with the negative 1) our room was very small (about 3 sq meters) it was also very warm and the air conditioning was very ineffective, our room faced the inner courtyard of the hotel so there was no view, however it was quiet enough to leave the windows open while we were sleeping. 2) the location is not as central as I was expecting, its a good 20 minutes walk to the Spanish steps, which is the nearest metro stop so you will probably need to get cab with luggage. Also although there is a good selection of Restaurants in the area they are expensive, you can find better food more cheaply in more centrally located areas. On the positive side: The staff are very helpful and friendly and the facilities excellent, the room despite being small was very comfortable, good bed, shower and a television + internet all provided (although you have to pay for internet use). There is an excellent buffet breakfast provided with a selection of meats, cereals, fruits and pastries, there is also a restaurant and the bar does snacks, although we didn't use either the snacks looked very good. Overall if we went back to Rome I would probably look for a hotel more centrally located, probably somewhere along the Tiber to cut down on the walking and also to place us close to the better restaurants and bars. But I could not fault the staff and facilities of the Oxford.

Reviews.Title: “Friendy Staff”
Reviews.Author: TimHorsham
Reviews.Content: A very clean and friendly hotel which sits a 20 min walk from the Spanish Steps Using the free map found in the reception we (2+2 family) found walking to most sites easy and uncomplicated Just around the corner from the hotel 5 minutes walk or less is Il Ristorantino a small Italian resturant with a good translation of the very good menu The staff dont speak english but it was not a problem at all and the Pasta was fabulous Wine was 6 euros for a litre of good house wine The address is Via Servio Tullio,8/10 if you visit the Collussium dont get taken in by the touts outside we queued for ten minutes and the two girls under 18 were free total cost 18 euros if you get a bus or taxi to the sights you will miss the little hidden gems which are found everywhere

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: Katie110
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed in the Oxford hotel on a short 2 night city break, have always wanted to go to Rome and was not disappointed! This hotel is lovely, great location, really close to the metro, Trevi Fountain and spanish steps! The staff are friendly, the hotel rooms are very small but clean....we found our bathroom behind a sliding door which i thought was a wardrobe! Breakfast was plentiful if you like cold meats and cheese in the mornings my partner just opted for coffee!! The bar staff are so friendly bringing over drinks and completmentry crisps/nuts. All in all had a lovely but tiring break!

Reviews.Title: “very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: newtravellerEngland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome . Having stayed at the Oxford Hotel . The hotel was clean and whilst the food was modest the restaraunt was clean and the breakfast plenty . Although we did ask for bacon and eggs [sooo English ] however the bacon was smoked and the eggs greasy ! The bedrooms were a little small but the beds were larger than a king, possibly a queen . The staff were all very helpfull and pleasant . On the whole the Oxford made a great base and we would stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “A little luxury for the weary traveller”
Reviews.Author: kath19
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Oxford was brilliant - the minute we walked in we were treated like stars. While they processed our booking we were invited to sit and have drinks at the bar - with a complimentary bowl of nuts. The room itself had a nice view, had internet and tv (for a price, but good value if you're on the internet most of the time, like my husband). The breakfast was nice and we had dinner one night in the restaurant. It's not particularly close to transport but we did manage to walk there from the central train station with 12kg backpacks. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location”
Reviews.Author: CLL040
Reviews.Content: This would have to be the smallest hotel room on record but we could not fault the cleanliness or comfort and how long do you really spend in your hotel room. The hotel is in a very quiet part of the city and it is a decent walk to anywhere but Rome is a very easy city to get around on foot. The staff were very helpful at all times and breakfast was good. We would highly recommend the hop-on, hop-off bus tour you can catch quite close to the hotel. There are quite a few good restaurants close by without paying the top prices on the via Veneto.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglandJoey
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel and were very impressed by the standard on offer. There were three of us in our room, which although quite small and did not have a view, was very clean. The hotel staff themselves were very friendly and only happy to assist you whether it be at breakfast, over a drink in the bar or whilst dining in the evening. Via veneto is most expensive for food so be careful. We tended to eat at the hotel as the food was excellent and very reasonably priced. The hotel is about 20 minutes from the trevi fountian and the spanish steps, but within the city it is very easy to access all attractions whether it be by taking a long walk or using the buses or metro. We purchased a metro day pass for 4 euros. I would definitely stay at the hotel Oxford again, one tip I would like to pass on is that rooms do not have a kettle so bring your own coffee and t bags and simply ask at the bar for a jug of hot water and some milk, they will even provide the cups, this is completely free and you can take it to your room and enjoy that well deserved cuppa

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied!!”
Reviews.Author: ikkiLuxembourg
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a three -day trip to Rome and had a very comfortable stay in that hotel! I have to admit that I have never seen a smaller room (other guests that I talked to had "normal" size rooms"), but the room was clean and there was everything one might possibly need. The bathroom was nice and clean, apart from the problem that the floor was flooded after each shower! Well, the lift only goes to second floor whereas the hotel has three floors (our room was on the third floor). The narrow stairs might really not be very suitable for elderly people, but what I found great is that there are boys to help you with your luggage. The reception staff as well as the waiters were extremely friendly, all of them speaking English, and very helpful! Breakfast contained a large choice and I think that even the most complicated person should be able to find enough to eat there. The hotel is close to the Spanish stairs, there is a bus stop about 5 minutes away from the hotel, but in fact we did everything on foot. We went to Rome by car and the hotel's parking service is excellent. They come and pick up your car in front of the hotel. Tell the receptionist when you need your car and it will be in front of the hotel in 2 minutes! Of course parking is quite expensive, but to be honest: I'd rather pay parking and know where my car is than try to find a parking space in the middle of Rome! All in all I have to say that one can really not expect more for the money that one pays for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Oxford hotel was a bit of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: EuroTravellerToronto
Reviews.Content: The Oxford Hotel was a bit of a disappointment after reading so many glowing reviews before booking. Our room was on the 3rd floor - the elevator only goes to the 2nd floor so navigating steep stairs and long twisty hallways was a bit of a surprise - this would be a very big problem for elderly or handicapped visitors. I also wonder how safe this place would be in the event of a fire. The room was clean though quite dated and a bit dowdy. The bathroom had been redone although the plumbing made very weird gurgling noises - we could also hear our neighbors quite clearly in our bathroom - ugh. The shower stall could be fully closed so there was no mopping up after a shower. The telephones didn't work during part of our stay but the air conditioning worked fine. The breakfast was adequate although beware the very sweet croissants and the coffee (they were both horrid). The front desk staff were very friendly. If taking a taxi to the airport, think twice about using the hotel "shuttle" - it is very expensive. One last point, the location of the hotel is not close to a subway (making a taxi almost essential if you have luggage) and the area is bland - we always went elsewhere for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay at the oxford”
Reviews.Author: Wisconsinfamily
Reviews.Content: Our agent recommended the Oxford, read good reviews prior to leaving, and had a very nice stay for 3 nights. Our room was very spacious, bathroom updated and clean. Flat screen t.v., in-room internet on t.v. as well as in lobby. Quiet. No view from window. Nice breakfast included with stay. Dinner in restaurant was good too. Staff nice and friendly. Walked from hotel to many major sites. Easier to cab it to train station than walking with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: rafaCumbria
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Oxford was a fantastic place to stay,we booked 2 rooms 218 and 220 and they were both fantastic.Every member of staff were helpful and polite especially the barman.20 mins walk to Spanish Steps,used Ciao Roma open top bus for 19 euros well worth it but very hot..Hotel is just 5 mins walk from Via Veneto but beware of prices of food and drink.Overall my family had a fantastic break and the Hotel Oxford i would definitely stay at again

Reviews.Title: “good apart from”
Reviews.Author: bingoCumbria
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of June 07 very clean/ small bathroom but other wise ok , Just a WARNING to anyone staying at this hotel THEY WILL CONSIFICATE YOUR TRAVEL IRON AND KETTLE SO HIDE THEM the rooms have no tea/coffee making facility or iron, also when I asked the reception Can I borrow an iron, I was told to take my clothes to the laundry down the street. If only they had the above facilities I would rate this hotel as excellent or above

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NormaFay
Reviews.Content: We loved the Hotel Oxford. It was perfect! We were in Rome for 5 nights and we could get anywhere. The hotel staff was very helpful; we enjoyed breakfast and loved the European ambience. The rooms are small, but had everything we needed. It was clean, updated and modern! It seemed to be a busy hotel which tells me that this was an excellent choice. I felt we got lots of value for our money. Norma Kaplan May 2007

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Chicago1996
Reviews.Content: We came back from very nice mini-vacations in Rome a few days ago. Hotel "Oxford" is conveniently located to Termini and many sites as well. Just short walk to Borghese Park thru beatiful Via Veneto. Only Vatican is on qiet distance and a few bus routes will take you there. We took bus 64 from Republica st. (1.25euro). We would advice to buy a bus tour with audio guide for 20 euros when the first time in Rome. You can find boocklet in the hotel. Hotel's staff are friendly and care of all your needs. Next time in Rome we'll come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: IMPSurrey
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from 5 night stay at the Hotel Oxford. The hotel is situated in a nice location within walking distance of the many sites and close to the Metro station. The room (3rd floor-lift only goes to second!) was adequate but very clean as were the bathroom (quite large). The bed linen and towels were changed every day. The only problem we encountered was that the shower used to flood the bathroom floor. Breakfast was good with all the usual, croissant, cereals, rolls, cheese hams fresh fruit and fruit juices, The snack bar and bar were reasonably priced for a hotel. We were recommended a restaurant by another English couple staying at the hotel, It was EXCELLENT. Come out of the hotel Oxford turn left, then first left into Via Sicilia-BRANCALEONE OSTERIA-PIZZERIA. Pizzas to die for. excellent spaghetti, all the meats were certificated and the vegetables organic. Cheap wine ENORMOUS helpings Very reasonably priced and really friendly. Would stay at this hotel again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: EnglandSurrey
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4-day stay at the Hotel Oxford. Hotel was great value for money with excellent breakfast and very friendly and helpful staff. Hotel Bar and Restaurant at very reasonable prices - far cheaper than at outside venues! Good location with easy access to main sites, but with excellent choice of restaurants in walking distance of the hotel at very good prices. Far better value than those near to the tourist sites. You only need to take a walk around the nearby streets to find plenty of choice of places to eat, whether formal or informal, and interesting shops as well. Very nice feel to the area, being so near to the upmarket Via Veneto. Hotel near to Borghese gardens, so nice to have somewhere green and open to sit and escape from the hustle and bustle of Rome. We walked everywhere from the hotel, but good metro and bus access nearby. An excellent place to stay and would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: MargaretSouthWales
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four day stay and we had a wonderful time. The hotel is very clean and all the staff were so very friendly and helpful. Had a meal in the restaurant on our last evening and it was far better and reasonably priced than some of the restaurants we ate at in the town. Drinks in the bar were reasonable as well. Our room was large with a bathroom, shower, double bed and a sofa. It was easy to find and near to all the places you need to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MCB27
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay [arrived Sunday and left Wednesday]. The hotel was excellent, much better than we'd dared to hope for after trawling through the reviews of many other hotels. The bedrooms were of a very good standard, very clean and comfortable with an enormous double bed. The bathrooms were immaculate and the shower very powerful. We were on the second floor and had a nice view overlooking the tree lined street. There was a nice comfortable area downstairs to sit and have a drink which were very reasonably priced compared to other places. We were very lucky with the weather for the beginning of March, it was hot and sunny every day. The location was very good - we took an open top bus tour [from the Termini about 15 minutes walk away] to familiarise ourselves with all the sites and we did the tour again the same evening to see the city by night. It was good value for money at 13 euro for the whole day. We walked from the hotel to all the sites so didn't use the metro or local buses, although it did seem a long walk back uphill from the Vatican City! Had a great night at the Hard Rock Cafe, which is only a few minutes walk away from the hotel. The breakfasts were good and there was plenty of choice, apart from the fruit juices which appeared to be over sweetened fruit cordial. Overall, a very good hotel at a reasonable price. I would recommend it to anyone visiting Rome and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: andrewStainesUk
Reviews.Content: recently enjoyed a very pleasant stay at the oxford in rome with my wife and two young children. The room wasnt big but perfectly adequate for sleeping and bathroom was clean, well stocked and had a lovely powerful shower. The public areas were pleasant to sit in and the continental breakfast was fine although we would have preferred proper fruit juice instead of cordial. The hotel was in a good location, easy walking distance to two metro stations and the via venetto just up the road. Rome itself was lovely but do beware that everyone is out to rip off the tourist at every opportunity. We were chased by a roman soldier near the forum ruins because we dared take his photo without paying him and we were ripped off at a restaurant opposite the colesseum along with another british family. We refused to pay inflated bills and were cursed and threatened in italian. DO NOT EAT NEAR ANY ATTRACTION..seems to be a good piece of advice. Always check the menu for prices especially drinks and be very aware if no drinks prices on the menu. However we ate at a very nice place just off the via venetto called La Scala. lovely food and good service. Street vendors selling tatty toys also seemed to make a beeline for the children and there are beggars everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL hotel- would return anytime!!”
Reviews.Author: londongirl2007
Reviews.Content: After trailing through reviews of hotels for weeks, my boyfriend and I finally settled on the Oxford hotel, but we still weren't sure. However, when we got there we were beyond suprised- it was better than anything we expected! In CIAMPINO airport we got a taxi which cost 40 euros, and took about 35mins to get to the hotel. The hotel is very elegant, cosy and pretty I think are the best words to describe it. Even though we arrived early in the morning, and check-in wasn't until later the guy at reception said it would be no problem and gave us our room keys there and then. One thing to note- the lift is TEENY TINY. Im suprised me and boyfriend fit in! The tiniest lift ive ever seen! The room however, we stayed at 212 on the 2nd floor-it has 3 in total, was lovely. VERY clean, fresh-smelling, sunny, wonderful street view from a huge window. The double bed was 2 big beds pushed together. There was a hairdryer, mini-bar (with a few cans of coke, beer, peanuts, basic), flat-screen tv with internet access and films for 10 euros each. Plenty of storage space for clothes, good sized wardrobe, and the room was of good size. Bathroom lovely again. BUT there are no irons- and you are not allowed them due to fire regulations, so make sure to do all your ironing at home. The staff were pleasant. The hotel has a very cosy, beautiful snack bar downstairs which is open until 11.30pm, where you can buy drinks, hot drinks, sandwiches and dessert (mainly ice cream and tiramasu in italy!). The barman was very friendly and smiley. There is a restraunt also- very good food at reasonable prices, and the lemon sorbet is delicious- you must try it, it comes in an actual frozen lemon! As is the vegetable soup. However when we ate there at 7pm on night the soup was delicious, then we came back 2 nights later (mainly for the soup!) 20 mins before the restaurant closed (9.20pm) and it was completely tasteless, like water, so maybe they were getting ready to close, all the soup had finished and the chef just made that up qucikly. Also our second course was quite cold too. So my advice would be to go early rather than late!! Location- The hotel is within I'd say an 8 min walk to Barberini square, where all the main restraunts are, buses, tubes etc. Then from there another 15min walk to Trevi fountain, Spanish steps etc. However we did get a bus to the Colleseo and Vatican, which took about 10mins from Barbarini. So the hotel is not right in the center, but you can certainly walk to anywhere you want or just jump on a bus (to be honest we never bought a ticket, although everyone did, as we couldnt find where to buy them from) the metro is 1 euro per single journey. The area around the hotel is really nice, beautiful buildings surround it and me and my boyfriend often took a nice relaxing walk late at night around the hotel and we always felt safe. Money- If you think Rome is cheap, think again! :) Prices for food, clothes, jewellery,cosmetics etc were the same as London prices or higher. But there are lots of very good quality silk tie and shirt shops that are very good value for money and have tons of choice. Also some shops we went into obviously saw us as the guilable tourists we were and over-charged us (we bought 2 bottles of barcadi breezer, 1 bottle of beer and a sandwich and were charged 24 euros!!) It wasnt till we left we realised but i guess u learn! So Id advice going to normal supermarkets/food shops rather than the small ones that dont use tills. The T.V in the room has many channels but all but 2 are in italian, the other 2 are CNN and a sports channel. It would have been nice to have a few more english channels. We found ourselves getting in late and wanting to cuddle up with a bottle of wine and a bit of tv late at night but all there was to watch was the skiing! (but u can get a 10 euro film- lots of choices, but we didnt really wanna do that every night) Overall a lovely pleasant, eegant hotel- will come back as soon as i can! p.s there is no room service but for 3 euro they will bring you breakfast to your room in the morning- very basic but nice I would definitely return here again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Oxford - A welcome return”
Reviews.Author: Angspar
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Oxford and as per usual it did not disappoint! My family stayed at the Oxford November 2004. When we decided to return to Rome there was no question we would return to the Oxford. This time we decided to take on of the apartments located nearby at 77 Via Flavia. For our group of five the apartment couldn't have been better. Two bedroom, two bath, a very comfortable pull out couch as well as a well appointed kitchenette and a dining/living room, made this apartment the perfect home base for us. It was nice to see familiar faces upon our return to the Oxford. Stephano at the front desk is charming, friendly and well organized. He made us feel like visiting family instead of returning guests. What sets the Oxford apart is the wonderful bar. As bars go it's pretty typical, but the bartenders are not. Everytime we have visited the bar it is full of people like ourselves who were made to feel like they were the only patrons. It has the feeling of "Cheers" with a more contiental flair. The Oxford is located just off the Via Veneto near many restaraunts and local shops (don't miss the little Sauce shop located next to the charming La Lampada ristorante. The 'sauce guy' is very cute and knowledgeable about olive oil, pesto etc. And when you go La Lampada, Salvatore will make your visit special). Piazza Barberini is about a 5 minute walk with the Spanish Steps, Piazza di Popolo and Trevi Fountain about a 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: westernsydney
Reviews.Content: We recntly stayed in the apartments connected to his hotel in the Via Piave. The apartments were new and spacious. The staff were very helpful. the airconditioning and bathrooms were excellent. The restaurant in the hotel served simple food well.

Reviews.Title: “Be Specific As To Type Of Room”
Reviews.Author: HillyG
Reviews.Content: Our first room offered was a very small double hardly room to move, the second was not much better. the third was what we requested when we booked a few months ago I would have thought that our booked requests should have been met. Once in an accepteble room, we found the staff very helpful and the location of the hotel ideal for siteseeing. Don't go to eat on the Via Veneto very expensive. There is a lovely wine bar down a side street from the hotel, that does lovely food, though english is not spoken or understood very much., but we made ourselves understood, very good sign language!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room and it was spacious and clean. We actually had two bedrooms (one with two twin beds and one with a double bed) so we were not cramped. The air conditioning worked very well, which seemed to be a rare occurrence in Italy. The hotel staff were very polite and helpful and made us feel welcome-- they were happy to call a taxi for us and the restaurants they recommended were very good. The breakfast was excellent. The only drawback is that the hotel is not very close to ancient Rome and the Metro stop is a 15-min walk. We had to take taxis to/from most of our destinations because it was a long walk back after being on our feet all day. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I got marrid in Rome in October of 2005 and stayed in the Oxford after seeing in recommended in a few guide books. The staff were excellent, the lovely Rosalba on reception along with the rest of the staff were more than helpful and organised many things for us without question. We had 13 friends staying there also and everyone was very well looked after. A complementry bottle of champagne in our room when we returned from the church was a nice touch. Mario in the bar is an institution to himself. The Oxford has a great location in a very safe and central area, with bus links 1 minute walk away, and all the main attractions within 20 minutes, 10 in a taxi. Rome is not known for its great hotel accomadation - unless 5 star is an option for you - and it does cost more than most European Capitals - and although the rooms at the Oxford are small, you won't be spending much time in your room anyhow as there is so much to do and see in Rome. We found it clean with a good restaurant and bar menu. As for some of the negative reviews I've read of the hotel and its staff on this site, it seems that maybe some people came to the hotel with greater expections than I did. For me it provided a great location, friendly staff(you have to friendly in return too you know), a bed that saw little sleep and the base for an unforgettable week.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for five days in August 2005. We thoroughly enjoyed the hotel, all very friendly and so helpful, nothing seemed too much trouble. Service and meals were good and lovely to spend a late night at the bar. Will certainly stay here again on our next trip to Rome, within easy walking distance of just about everywhere inc the Terminii. The best free book on Rome we've seen anywhere available in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room”
Reviews.Author: ruxpin
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel Oxford in Rome. Our room was tiny and the bathroom even smaller. We were tempted to complain but decided that as we would be spending so little time in the room there was no point. Breakfast was poor: horrible croissants and no choice of anything other than a buffet. I would recommend staying off of the Via Del Corso, far more central.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want a tennis-court sized room, stay in a Sheraton or a Holiday Inn. This hotel is a clean, simple, European fare. Nicely appointed; good, reasonably-priced meals in the restaurant, and an acceptable walk from the Metro station, the Oxford suited three of us very well. It's in a safe neighborhood where one is not harrassed or afraid to search the odd street for a restaurant and we found several very good ones. A good base for a city visit.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay, not the best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't really know why everyone is raving about the location. This hotel is about 7 blocks north east of the spanish steps. You could walk but it'd take you a while. We had to take a taxi everywhere. The plus side is there are a lot of good restaurants about 3 blocks away, but nothing more. The rooms are teeny-tiny. I mean, small. But if you're just staying a few nights it's okay. I wouldn't start your vacation at this hotel, maybe just a passing through hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I Was Robbed Of 400 Euros from my safe depositi box in roome 114”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I only kept my money bag to and from rome in the money bag in my underpants. I had 4 single 100 euros and then smaller denominations, using only those throughout my stay, only to discover that the 4 single euros were no longer there. Someone in the hotel knew how to open my safe deposit box. So, my comments are that this hotel has THE WRONG KIND OF STAFF. DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL. THEY ARE NOT TO BE TRUSTED, even though the rooms are just decent, and the location is very good. The staff was not that accomodating, either.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms small but clean bathroom miniscular. However the staff and area wonderful. Will return again..

Reviews.Title: “Plasant hotel offering a good location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Oxford in September 2005 after finding it in a guide for the discerning traveller. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from the Termini central station, a 25 minute walk from the Colosseum, and St Peters can be reached after about 10 minutes walking an a 10 minute metro ride. As Rome is such an expensive city in terms of accommodation, it is hard to use the term 'good value' when referring to the hotels on offer. However, the Hotel Oxford is one of the cheaper 3* hotels that I found, and yet in terms of the location, fittings, bathroom, cleanliness and ambiance, you would rate the hotel as one of the best in the 3* category. The highlight is the central location, which feels very safe, just off the Via Veneto, and near useful transport links. The downside is the breakfast - chaotic and limited. For me an additional minus point was that despite having booked a double room, and then emailing the hotel to confirm we would have a double room as confirmation, we were offered a twin room upon arrival. When I queried this, I was told that it was my fault as although they had promised a double room to me, they understand the word 'double' to mean twin! The following night our room was changed as requested and we were presented with a chilled bottle of sparking wine, delivered to our room in an ice bucket. In summary, I would recommend the hotel to others, as the quality of the experience belies the price.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, reasonably priced, close enough to the sites (10 minutes Spanish Steps, 15 tops to the Trevi), friendly staff. Some rooms are a little small (try getting room 320, its excellent, large and quiet). Restaurant is not too expensive and does some good food, breakfast is brilliant. Mario the barman is superb, a real star, great cocktails, great service, a proper gentleman. If you are on a budget try the restaurant around the corner, do a left out of the hotel and then left again, called something like Baitta, not exactly cheap but superb food and a good meal for 3 for around 60 Euros. If you are on a tight budget a 5 minute or so walk up the Via Salaria is a Pizza joint that does very good take away food at bargain prices, and also large bottles of Peroni beer for around 2 Euros! I would definitely recommend this hotel, it is not the cheapest but is is very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable hotel”
Reviews.Author: CMC-24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from 25th to 29th July 2005. The Hotel was ideal for us in all respects. Our room was clean, tidy, well equipped and air conditioned. The room was not terribly large but there is a lot to do in Rome so we were not intending to spend much time in our room. The Hotel Restaurant provided good quality food for evening meals. The location of the hotel was ideal for us as we walked or used the public transport systems to see the city's sites. All of the staff were courteous, helpful and made us feel most welcome. We would certainly recommend this hotel and would hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, loved the room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from 10-16th of July, on our honeymoon trip. The hotel is located just off Via Veneto street and Barberini square and metro station. You can walk to almost everywhere. The breakfast was great and the staff very helpful. The room was more than satisfactory, very clean and comfortable. Its an excellent value for money and I would definetely stay there again. On the street near the hotel ( exit walk left and left again and again right ) on Via Sicilia is a restaurant called Piccollo Abruzzo. It was amazing. We've had sort of a menu for two persons, traditional italian recipes. If someone stays there, should go to that restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the Hotel Oxford”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms and washroom were clean, the staff was very nice.
